subject: Technology
title: The PDA: Smartphones Before Smartphones
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The PDA: Smartphones Before Smartphones.

hook.text: In the 1990s, personal digital assistants promised to put a computer in your pocket. They almost delivered.

buildup.text: Devices like the Palm Pilot stored contacts, calendars, and notes. You wrote on them with a tiny stylus.

discovery.text: PDAs proved people wanted pocket computers. But they couldn't make calls or connect to the internet.

twist.text: When phones got smart enough, PDAs vanished overnight. The smartphone ate their entire market.

climax.text: Every feature the PDA pioneered lives on in your phone today: contacts, calendars, notes, and more.

punchline.text: PDAs were smartphones without the phone. Close, but not enough.

quiz.question: What was the main limitation of PDAs?
options: They couldn't make calls or access the internet
